00dd0446-f7a1-4e86-9282-596ea04909e2: A 1st level sensei can use his performance to inspire courage in his allies (including himself), bolstering them against fear and improving their combat abilities. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive the sensei's performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and fear effects and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. At 5th level, and every six sensei levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level.
0cff07a9-830f-4dca-98f9-09c51d427892: A character can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility. If a character makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against an attack that normally deals half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, he instead takes no damage. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of evasion.
3f5daa22-f474-4786-9a40-62b0e6313d4d: A monk can set up vibrations within the body of another creature that can thereafter be fatal if the monk so desires. You make {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} and if it succeeds the target must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 the monk's level + the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} modifier) or die. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that costs 4 ki points.
1a95e329-eb46-480f-918f-e57860891ae0: A monk gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to his current monk level + 10. In order to affect the monk with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, a spellcaster must get a result on a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) that equals or exceeds the monk's spell resistance.
89aa6812-52e2-43df-9146-534c9e2d0290: A monk with this ki power can spend 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to gain temporary, intuitive insight into the immediate future during his next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. The monk's next single attack roll (if it is made before the end of the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}) gains a +20 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. Additionally, he is not affected by the miss chance that applies to attackers trying to strike a {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealed{/g} target.
e1f0ba36-b4e4-4954-b4ee-053d431d3d73: A monk with this ki power can spend 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to grant himself a tough skin. The effect grants a +2 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to the monk's existing natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This enhancement bonus increases by 1 for every three {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} above 3rd, to a maximum of +5 at 12th level.
b2bf64f3-bbef-46c1-9fe6-05c694dfadd9: A monk with this ki power can spend 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant himself a sudden burst of {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. This increases the monk's base land speed by 30 feet for 1 minute.
b5411249-fd54-4354-aa7d-5be5d01cc3e0: A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to blast his enemies with a searing beam of fire. The monk may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}.
f9e00067-cac1-4d21-bc87-bd0e80956930:
A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to dispel temporary negative levels or one permanent negative level.
{g|SpellsRestoration}Restoration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cures{/g} all temporary {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, and it restores all points permanently drained from a single {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. It also eliminates any {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigue{/g} or {g|ConditionExhausted}exhaustion{/g} suffered by the target.
db488d85-81c4-4349-9356-e8858f2bb36e: A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to infect the subject with a horrible poison by making a successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This {g|SpellsPoison}poison{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds.
184a1390-13e9-41ce-8824-013023e44ded: A monk with this ki power can spend 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to spit a stream of venom at a target using a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. If the venom hits, it causes {g|ConditionBlind}blindness{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The target must also make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or be poisoned by black adder venom; the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} in successive rounds of the poison is equal to the ability's save DC.
2b3b4834-a43c-4dfc-a5a5-89762f2119d7: A monk with this ki power can spend 3 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to unleash a sudden blast of sonic energy that strikes his opponent. The target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} per level (maximum 20d6) and is {g|ConditionStunned}stunned{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}; a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} by half and negates the stun.
da7a6b4c-8e63-4b32-8fee-092c54ff0916: A monk with this ki power can spend 3 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to create a shredding flurry of ice slivers, which blast from his hand in a line. The line deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6).
ef644c51-1926-450b-8ba0-bef661699774: A sensei of 3rd level or higher can use his performance to help allies succeed at a task. They must be within 30 feet and able to see and hear the sensei. They get a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} as long as they continue to hear the sensei's performance. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the sensei has attained beyond 3rd (+3 at 7th, +4 at 11th, +5 at 15th, and +6 at 19th).
19d3ccbd-14dd-40f7-a928-494e1930ff64: A sensei of 9th level or higher can use his performance to inspire greatness in all allies within 30 feet, granting extra fighting capability. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} (d10s), the commensurate number of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} (apply the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saves{/g}.
422d8f59-0587-48b3-b4a8-1c30834108c0:
A sensei's advice is identical to bardic performance, allowing him to inspire courage at 1st level, inspire competence at 3rd level, and inspire greatness at 9th level, as a bard of the sensei's level, usable a total number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to his level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
Starting a bardic performance is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, but it can be maintained each round as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. Changing a bardic performance from one effect to another requires the sensei to stop the previous performance and start a new one as a standard {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. A bardic performance cannot be disrupted, but it ends immediately if the sensei is killed, {g|ConditionParalyzed}paralyzed{/g}, {g|ConditionStunned}stunned{/g}, knocked {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, or otherwise prevented from taking a free action to maintain it each round. A sensei cannot have more than one bardic performance in effect at one time.
e50385b6-d5c5-4b87-8af4-571c35d38fd0: A sohei gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} equal to 1/2 his monk level. At 20th level, a sohei's initiative roll is automatically a natural 20.
5dfe1f96-aeae-4c4f-b852-b026f400d4cf: A sohei gains {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}.
c83945fb-c6d9-48fe-8575-bd09783ebc71: A sohei is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with light armor, instead of a monk's usual weapon and armor proficiencies. When wearing armor, using a shield, or carrying a medium or heavy load, a monk loses his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}, as well as his fast movement and flurry of blows abilities.
2fd9c250-1958-4b42-88b1-0eb3aa8892fc: A sohei may select mounted combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as bonus feats.
06cf884a-c226-4c82-8bb5-cf3e49cdb90f: A sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} does not increase at 4th level and above.
7734bc92-3aa2-484f-9a2b-2f3037cae15d:
A zen archer's bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} must be taken from the following list:
Combat Reflexes, Deflect Arrows, Dodge, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, and Rapid Shot.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved Precise Shot, Manyshot and Mobility.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved Critical and Clustered Shot.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.
d1c24197-725d-411d-ac78-f8fbeacc0d8a: Although most consider it to be the weakest and most feral of the chromatic dragons, the white dragon makes up for its lack of cunning with sheer ferocity.
fcb6ebe1-e687-4a93-b664-15b7f6e9a26b:
At 10th level, a sensei may spend 1 point from his ki pool (as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}) while using advice to provide a single ally within 30 feet with evasion, fast movement, high jump, purity of body, or slow fall.
At 14th level, a sensei may spend 2 points to grant one of the abilities listed above to all allies within 30 feet, or provide improved evasion to a single ally within 30 feet. These abilities function at the sensei's level and last 1 minute.
96fecf62-9653-46f6-bed7-abb46d8903b3: At 10th level, ki strike allows the sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful{/g} weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
902c9de8-12e6-465f-ae2d-60b09dff36bf: At 10th level, the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful{/g} weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
874e7b2e-849d-4bd8-a0d9-eaf9d68b9811:
At 12th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a student of stone can spend 1 ki point to gain tremorsense 15 feet until his next turn.
At 16th level, the range of this tremorsense increases to 30 feet.
Tremorsense: You can perceive the world by creating high-pitched noises and listening to their echoes. This gives you blindsight of equal range.
37b047d1-def3-48e9-a38f-efbd536fbc27: At 12th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was two {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger.
a966dce1-9b3c-4ce9-abf8-8de1d48ae0b1: At 13th level, a quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free disarm attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
cbc1eeff-e6d0-408d-8ec3-832df4ba6b92: At 13th level, a sensei can start a bardic performance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
0fe09789-6871-4484-a6f3-96527fb67a22: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per monk level in a 30-foot cone. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
5267626e-2708-48f8-be70-bf15914fb983: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per monk level in a 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
fb0ee29e-7ed5-4b83-871c-3fd980139c55: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per monk level in a 30-foot cone. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
8209b617-db33-46a4-ae59-3e44a350bb56: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per monk level in a 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
453bc5c3-b12c-43c1-987b-88675d848fcb: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per monk level in a 30-foot cone. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
8f236bd7-b5fc-4cfd-beda-77c1a14e7a94: At 15th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per monk level in a 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
035fa29b-6482-4af3-a1e5-46a95ed3d3ab: At 16th level, ki strike allows the sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and bypassing hardness.
7b5eb256-59a4-4cae-994b-4a8e386b3b61: At 16th level, the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} are treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and bypassing hardness.
4357d5dd-de0a-4c2c-8833-4a3a3b38c133: At 1st level a sohei gains a horse as a mount. A sohei may spend 1 point from his ki pool to grant his mount temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to twice his level for 1 hour per level.
9cc97808-a988-4339-a2a7-f10ab4a74569:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Critical, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.
28802c85-48a5-427e-9016-e66730f50ed7:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a scaled fist can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Dragon Style, Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm, Dazzling Display, Dragon Ferocity.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Critical, Dragon Roar.
A scaled fist need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.
b96f6717-2b8b-486d-a6b5-b43ef99f1647:
At 1st level, a monk can make a flurry of blows as a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. When making a flurry of blows, the monk can make one additional attack at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. This additional attack stacks with the bonus attacks from {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} and other similar effects. When using this ability, the monk can make these attacks with any combination of his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strikes{/g} and weapons that have the monk special weapon quality. He takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for using multiple weapons when making a flurry of blows, but he does not gain any additional attacks beyond what's already granted by the flurry for doing so. (He can still gain additional attacks from a high base attack bonus, from this ability, and from haste and similar effects).
At 11th level, a monk can make an additional attack at his highest base attack bonus whenever he makes a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.
1a676736-29ad-420e-949d-c3dc4f6c9a5e:
At 1st level, a monk gains Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by a Medium monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g} increases with level: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} at levels 1–3, 1d8 at levels 4–7, 1d10 at levels 8–11, 2d6 at levels 12–15, 2d8 at levels 16–19, and 2d10 at level 20.
If the monk is Small, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d4 at levels 1–3, 1d6 at levels 4–7, 1d8 at levels 8–11, 1d10 at levels 12–15, 2d6 at levels 16–19, and 2d8 at level 20.
If the monk is Large, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d8 at levels 1–3, 2d6 at levels 4–7, 2d8 at levels 8–11, 3d6 at levels 12–15, 3d8 at levels 16–19, and 4d8 at level 20.
b3ff9df4-966a-4b4e-b8ff-651083c45d3e:
At 1st level, a quarterstaff master can make a flurry of blows as a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. When making a flurry of blows, the monk can make one additional attack at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. This additional attack stacks with the bonus attacks from {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} and other similar effects. When using this ability, the quarterstaff master can make these attacks only with quarterstaves.
At 11th level, a quarterstaff master can make an additional attack at his highest base attack bonus whenever he makes a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.
d6b698a3-fa21-4877-8490-b0229cd703f5: At 20th level, a student of stone becomes an outsider with the earth subtype. He gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/{g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotic{/g}, and tremorsense 20 feet.
3dfe32f2-d503-44c3-b046-7ea1ee160007: At 20th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was three {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger.
7bb27312-0c9b-4f6a-8e72-d84897a01b46: At 2nd level, a sensei may use his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} in lieu of his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strikes{/g} or monk weapons.
5d06d6a5-532a-4206-b1c7-851aabc7585a:
At 2nd level, a zen archer gains Weapon Focus as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} with one type of bow.
At 6th level, the monk gains Weapon Specialization with the same weapon as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
50cf3db8-9dd5-46e5-9658-c63dc919ccbc: At 2nd level, whenever an opponent {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} to confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against a student of stone, treat the student of stone's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} as +4 higher than normal.
ee7106d2-6f13-418a-958d-2870691df5a4: At 3rd level, a monk gains a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, which increases by 10 feet every 3 levels thereafter. A monk in armor loses this extra speed.
9901f106-3df9-4880-8231-4ac7157b38eb:
At 3rd level, a monk gains a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. A monk in armor or carrying a medium or heavy load loses this extra speed.
For every 3 levels above 3rd, the bonus improves by 10 feet.
6a840217-13d0-47d8-be61-540fa80dc11f:
At 3rd level, a monk gains a pool of ki points, supernatural energy he can use to accomplish amazing feats. The number of points in a monk's ki pool is equal to 1/2 his monk level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. As long as he has at least 1 point in his ki pool, he can make a ki strike.
At 3rd level, ki strike allows his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
At 7th level, his unarmed {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are also treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
At 10th level, his unarmed attacks are also treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful{/g} weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
At 16th level, his unarmed attacks are treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction and bypassing hardness.
By spending 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a monk can make one additional unarmed strike at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}attack bonus{/g} when making a flurry of blows attack. This bonus attack stacks with all bonus attacks gained from flurry of blows, as well as those from {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} and similar effects. A monk gains additional powers that consume points from his ki pool as he gains levels.
The ki pool is replenished each morning after 8 hours of {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g} or meditation; these hours do not need to be consecutive.
18873cf9-efff-42b1-9248-8ebd4cd5c104: At 3rd level, a scaled fist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} attempted against all fear, paralysis, and sleep effects.
4046d569-77e3-4a4a-82aa-865fd150867a: At 3rd level, a student of stone learns to draw strength from the earth. So long as he is touching the ground, the student of stone gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, bull rush and trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, and to his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when resisting a bull rush or trip attempt.
1176b6e7-a3ad-4a44-b97f-9f4b8a310fc8: At 3rd level, a zen archer gains Point-Blank Master as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.
620a01ed-77b3-4fdf-8c22-8a1d8d4b9b2e: At 3rd level, a zen archer may use his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier instead of his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} rolls when using a bow.
5405cd74-8738-4b79-b717-7b9b3ef17aaa: At 3rd level, ki strike allows the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
c100ff3d-3b37-453d-bffd-48d9a435ed47: At 3rd level, ki strike allows the sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
f05425b4-86a3-4f5b-9784-b45a7dc4bf1c:
At 3rd level, the scaled fist has gained some control over the draconic energies she studies. She must select one type of dragon.
Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. The scaled fist can expend 1 point from her ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to imbue her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} with the energy specific to this dragon, causing them to deal an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her monk level.
At 12th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals 1d6 points of damage of her energy type per monk level in a 30-foot cone or 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal damage.
ef1f13b1-b04d-40ce-9ce9-fef58cb097d5: At 4th level and every 2 levels thereafter, a monk can select one ki power. These powers allow the monk to perform amazing feats of mystical power and acrobatic prowess by expending points from his ki pool. Once a ki power is selected, it cannot be changed. Some ki powers require the monk to be of a specific level or higher before they can be chosen. Unless otherwise noted, a monk cannot select an individual ki power more than once.
6234afa1-b257-4503-9064-85a05792a4d8: At 4th level, a monk gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
f4fd4135-a9ff-4e24-9e44-bf1eda8370a7: At 4th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a sohei may spend 1 point from his ki pool to grant any weapon he wields (including his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g}) a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, increasing by +1 per four levels after 4th to a maximum bonus of +5 at 20th level, until the end of his next turn.
28fc1b52-3646-4bac-9c7e-7cf0d1cf1669: At 4th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was one {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category larger.
0600b107-96ed-4e4d-9892-6e26bb6c6226: At 5th level, a monk can learn one type of style strike. Whenever he makes a flurry of blows, he can designate one of his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strikes{/g} as a style strike. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} is resolved as normal, but it has an additional effect depending on the type of strike chosen. At 9th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk learns an additional style strike. He must choose which style strike to apply before the attack roll is made. At 15th level, he can designate up to two of his unarmed strikes each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a style strike, and each one can be a different type.
758129f3-b28f-4e7a-8d9d-efb5349fb5fa: At 5th level, a quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free trip attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
3fcd9ec7-0457-4b9e-b2f1-bac1abe966df: At 5th level, a zen archer always deals his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with the arrows from his bows. For example, a Medium zen archer's short bow normally deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage; using this ability, his arrows deal 1d8 damage.
feb1547b-8519-4331-aafd-96afaa395303:
At 6th level, a sensei may use his advice ability when spending points from his ki pool to activate a class ability (using the normal {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} required for each) in order to have that ability affect one ally within 30 feet rather than the sensei himself.
At 10th level, a sensei may affect all allies within 30 feet rather than himself (spending points from his ki pool only once, not once for each target).
a35f6850-ab47-45d1-8d65-75b05eecba09: At 6th level, a sohei gains weapon training in one of the following weapon groups, as the fighter class feature: bows, crossbows, monk weapons, polearms, spears, or thrown weapons. He may select an additional group of weapons for every six levels after 6th, to a maximum of three at 18th level. A sohei may use flurry of blows and ki strike with any weapon in which he has weapon training.
34d18944-57d1-46ac-a48a-ffd704ead835:
At 6th level, a student of stone adds Elemental Fist to his list of available bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If the student of stone selects Elemental Fist as a bonus feat, he may only deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} when using the feat.
At 10th level, the student of stone adds Shaitan Style to his list of bonus feats.
At 14th level, he adds Shaitan Skin.
At 18th level, he adds Shaitan Earthblast.
3612ebc4-c6c6-417e-b3c6-34a84d459d0a: At 7th level, a sensei can start a bardic performance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}.
2bcf4307-a02d-4edb-999a-80b603546534:
At 7th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a student of stone can spend 1 ki point to gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 2/magic until the beginning of his next turn.
At 10th level, he can spend 1 ki point to gain DR 2/{g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotic{/g} until his next turn.
At 15th level, he can spend 1 ki point to gain DR 5/chaotic until his next turn.
f88746b5-76d2-4da4-9e57-b6e98d2b4791: At 7th level, ki strike allows the sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
0ba88c10-e6cd-4c63-917a-20376acd2793: At 7th level, the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} are treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
3b3755b5-a828-4ea8-a083-545358a38bb5: At 8th level or higher, a monk can slip magically between spaces, as if using the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsDimensionDoor}dimension door{/g}. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} that consumes 2 points from his ki pool. He cannot take other creatures with him when he uses this ability.
c7dd4af4-3ba6-497b-9bf3-36bab9e353ba: At 9th level, a quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free sunder attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
27bc01c5-260b-4a3b-949f-91882501144e: At 9th level, a student of stone gains the benefits of the light fortification armor property.
33aa8312-94b9-47f1-bc5b-dd1b4c7ceb7f:
At 9th level, a zen archer gains the Snap Shot {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the zen archer already has it, he gains Improved Snap Shot instead.
The zen archer doesn't need to meet the prerequisites to gain Snap Shot or Improved Snap Shot.
32f03e60-192b-44be-99db-9d272f70f966: Benefit: When you use Elemental Fist, pick one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. On a successful hit, the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally plus {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage of the chosen type. You must declare that you are using this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before you make your attack roll (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). You may attempt an Elemental Fist attack once per day plus one additional use for every four monk levels you have attained, and no more than once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
4a6cd8ad-76a1-4ad9-a010-8a95796ea163: Benefit: While using the Shaitan Style, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can spend two Elemental Fist attempts to unleash a column of acid that has a 10-foot radius and erupts from a point of origin within 30 feet of you. Creatures caught in the column take your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} from your Elemental Fist and are {g|ConditionStaggered}staggered{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier) reduces the damage by half and prevents the target from being staggered.
626b84d6-a9e8-4b63-8b18-07a59dc39a3c: Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist attempt per day. While using the Shaitan Style and Elemental Fist {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}, you gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus. Further, if your Elemental Fist {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} misses while you are using it to deal acid damage, you still deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of acid damage to your target.
0767c6fb-f82c-4481-9ebf-ff14b10115ec: Benefit: You gain one additional Elemental Fist attempt per day. While using the Shaitan Style, you gain acid {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. Creatures that take {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} from your Elemental Fist {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier) or be {g|ConditionStaggered}staggered{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
16f1cf38-9c24-44c3-8099-cb9c5a703236: Blue dragons are consummate schemers and obsessively orderly. In combat, blue dragons prefer to surprise foes if possible, and they are not above retreating if the odds turn against them.
6d981973-991f-4fd7-814a-8000516c9cc5: Bronze dragons have been known to ally with travelers and adventurers if the cause and reward is right and just.
deea6f5e-02c6-4219-973d-fb8c37cd29f1: By following the path of the stone, students of stone give up much of monk's mobility in favor of sheer resilience.
ecbdbf27-c9cc-4d6a-ae05-3994805008a3: By spending 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a monk can make one additional {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g} at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} when making a flurry of blows attack. This bonus attack stacks with all bonus attacks gained from flurry of blows, as well as those from {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} and similar effects.
fa1ef72e-f702-4628-b661-9ca573a14821: By spending 2 points from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the monk can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to his monk level.
b23f7cbb-04b2-49dc-a1bf-00dc37660d5b: Consummate conversationalists, brass dragons prefer to talk instead of fight.
8bcb9f63-b720-4504-9b16-5c29284b59e9: Copper dragons are whimsical and spend most of their time in combat trying to annoy and frustrate their enemies.
428b784e-a055-4b4e-8804-2314ee521145: Despite wearing no armor, monks can be strong defenders. They are very hard to hit, as their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g} gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from their {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} ability.
9ae1cf41-b122-4768-9c9a-94c188460955: Few creatures are more cruel and fearsome than the mighty red dragon. King of the chromatics, this terrible beast brings ruin and {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} to the lands that fall under its shadow.
a1abbf69-7c2f-41aa-99ca-091dad9676b9: Gold dragons are the epitome of virtue. Other metallic dragons revere their gold cousins as the agents of divine forces and the paragons of dragonkind, and often seek them for advice or aid.
867829d9-4c0c-4cbd-9659-53e1e7231c27: Green dragons dwell in the ancient forests of the world, prowling under towering canopies in search of prey. Of all the chromatic dragons, green dragons are perhaps the easiest to deal with diplomatically.
5de7d656-6d76-4ed1-9fa4-9bc1a678c747: Ki Strike — Cold Iron and Silver
3a3b7c29-4b5f-430d-9f3f-6bcf9d08cbc4: Lording over the darkest swamps and marshes, black dragons are the undisputed masters of their domain, ruling through cruelty and intimidation. Those who dwell within a black dragon's reach live in fear.
45a375ba-8781-4756-8aa9-1d7338b4c08f: Monks are masters of martial arts, deadly in melee combat. They fight with their bare hands, or with special monk weapons. A monk must have a lawful alignment, or they won't be able to advance.
adc1f8e9-fcfe-4407-8530-1fa9cb8d1c3d:
Monks are proficient with the club, crossbow (light or heavy), dagger, handaxe, javelin, kama, nunchaku, quarterstaff, sai, shortsword, shortspear, shuriken, siangham, sling, spear, and any weapon with the monk special weapon quality.
Monks are not proficient with any armor or shields.
When wearing armor, using a shield, or carrying a medium or heavy load, a monk loses his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}, as well as his fast movement and flurry of blows abilities.
c50ad4b6-7ee5-498e-a5c4-b85780e659b0: Monks can make additional {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} when they fight with bare hands or monk weapons. The higher their level is, the more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} they deal. A monk can also choose a style that would grant them additional attacks and powers, such as improvements to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g}, weakening the enemies, etc.
a897b0d6-2836-451a-b420-81a6d527d632: Monks excel at overcoming even the most daunting perils, striking where it's least expected, and taking advantage of enemy vulnerabilities. Fleet of foot and skilled in combat, monks can navigate any battlefield with ease, aiding allies wherever they are needed most.
96aded6a-0b13-475a-b33d-daab053053c9: Of all the dragons, silvers are the most courageous, holding themselves to a chivalrous code to help the weak, defeat evil, and behave in an honorable manner.
f3dd4fb9-3539-4f4e-9223-24a3b9f1722a: On a successful hit, your next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally plus {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}.
f109d937-7374-4720-becb-1ca5e207bba0: On a successful hit, your next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally plus {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
35d17471-39ac-4e90-9720-28c942491234: On a successful hit, your next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally plus {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}.
f2d9b05d-6285-47f8-9760-5c93cb313893: On a successful hit, your next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally plus {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}.
da9bd483-a4f4-4c4d-8ef1-28dc6ec4e27a: Sensei Advice: Mass Purity of Body
264692e4-89ab-4ce0-8a5e-77167864504b: Sensei Advice: Mass Wholeness of Body
1c11c193-1e50-40cf-8738-6846ac3f710b: Some monks focus their efforts on perfecting the way of one of the simplest weapons — a quarterstaff. They train until the quarterstaff becomes a natural extension of their own body.
ea510e73-6c87-4c19-816b-aa8ab786783b: Some monks seek to become one with another weapon entirely — the bow. The zen archer takes a weapon most other monks eschew and seeks perfection in the pull of a taut bowstring, the flex of a bow's limbs, and the flight of an arrow fired true.
4e45c045-b2ce-4be4-b2bf-75c37a762bcd:
Starting at 1st level, a zen archer can make a flurry of blows as a full-{g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, but only when using a bow (even though it is a ranged weapon). He may not make a flurry of blows with his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} or any other weapons. A zen archer does not apply his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with flurry of blows unless he is using a composite bow with a Strength rating.
A zen archer's flurry of blows otherwise functions as normal for a monk of his level.
A zen archer cannot use Rapid Shot or Manyshot when making a flurry of blows with his bow.
327d2517-869d-4691-9840-2692fdbe05ce: Steeped in traditions that trace their origins to the warrior-monks who trained under the tutelage of draconic masters, scaled fists eschew passive introspection in favor of unshakable confidence. Scaled fists learn to combine brutal intimidation with the brazen ferocity of an ancient wyrm to devastate their foes.
5e77137a-97de-4b46-8e3a-b75d179d032b: The monk attempts to sweep his foe's leg, knocking the opponent down. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, the monk can make a free trip attempt against the target of this strike (using the {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} of the attack used to hit the foe). This trip attempt does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
78966664-ef63-47bb-990e-d83dc6e63d92: The monk delivers a brutal punch that can penetrate defenses. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, it bypasses any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} or hardness possessed by the target of that attack.
7a5024a7-ce1a-427f-95cd-4b778f4dedef: The monk links his hands together, swinging both arms like a club and dealing tremendous {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, the monk {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g} damage twice, adding both rolls together before applying {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and other modifiers to the damage. This bonus damage is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
f80110cd-0ee9-4163-9c44-62f896136a90: The monk possesses a pool of ki energy that they can use to empower their {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} or activate {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. The ki pool replenishes when the monk {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rests{/g}. As the monk advances, they gain new {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} and powers that use the ki pool.
6c840bf5-82ba-4e2c-a638-086f7eca0fd8: The monk spins about, confounding his foe. If the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} hits, the monk gains a +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against any attacks made by the target of the style strike until the start of his next turn. This bonus does not stack with itself.
4175fef2-cf86-4d6b-9fca-65563037da27: The scaled fist can expend 1 point from her ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to imbue her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} with acid, causing them to deal an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her monk level.
b477c997-e0b2-4bdb-b499-f4d57a540fd3: The scaled fist can expend 1 point from her ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to imbue her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} with cold, causing them to deal an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her monk level.
f8d06a49-c6f6-4c00-ad72-2065fbe2009f: The scaled fist can expend 1 point from her ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to imbue her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} with electricity, causing them to deal an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her monk level.
627231cd-e0ef-4104-acb1-63a25b3a9a58: The scaled fist can expend 1 point from her ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to imbue her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} with fire, causing them to deal an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her monk level.
99d9b13c-a3c4-43de-8672-5ec57a53fab3: The sensei is a revered teacher who imparts lessons on the oneness of mind, body, and spirit, along with occasional correction that is subtle and swift. Rather than using wisdom for his own benefit alone, he uses it to better those around him.
d2fb48b3-c644-4457-b205-b5dc05a8c09f: The sohei are masters of the horse and the hunt. A monastic soldier, the sohei is equally adept at combat afoot or on horseback. While skilled in unarmed techniques, many sohei favor weapons they can use while mounted on horseback or against others' horses.
575edbff-84ff-450a-a998-bb92d6189e4e: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g} for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f7231b41-93dd-46a9-af0c-696f8bf98ca1: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g} for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f3be1c77-591f-4af3-a787-714b9ff5ca00: This ability works like evasion, except that while the character still takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against attacks, he henceforth takes only half damage on a failed save. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.
8081feff-3706-49ab-ac6b-b7dc121b4bea: Traditional monks walk the strict path of discipline which thousands of predecessors trod before them. They sacrifice the freedom to choose their power in exchange for steeled willpower and the trusted set of traditional abilities.
ca280a0d-1fd9-4665-9189-9c72c8b9df6e:
When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, at level 4 a monk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
These bonuses to AC apply even against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or when the monk is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. He loses these bonuses when he is immobilized or {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}, when he wears any armor, when he carries a shield, or when he carries a medium or heavy load. If a different class ability, like shifter's Defensive Instinct or barbarian's Cunning Elusion, also allows the character to add his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus to AC and CMD, these two bonuses cannot be applied simultaneously: the monk's class ability suppresses the others.
a75e2518-3e3b-48c2-b6e1-f3441cee93f9:
When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a monk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
These bonuses to AC apply even against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or when the monk is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. He loses these bonuses when he is immobilized or {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}, when he wears any armor, when he carries a shield, or when he carries a medium or heavy load.
ecdb53ec-186c-483f-b7e9-e9a90386fb33: When unarmored, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a monk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
f4ad4623-0762-4d1e-9d02-5f8f87ff4e50: When unarmored, the scaled fist adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a scaled fist gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four scaled fist levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
22e7d9b7-19ce-47fc-bf0c-b214c7799e38: While this ability is active, the monk's class ability no longer allows you to add your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. Instead, if another class ability, such as shifter's Defensive Instinct or barbarian's Cunning Elusion, would allow you to add your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus to AC and CMD, these abilities are no longer suppressed and apply as normal.
ce6d651c-15ca-4fd7-8b1a-23171ecd0f69: You can perceive the world by creating high-pitched noises and listening to their echoes. This gives you blindsight of equal range.
1dc7c592-ee63-4f4a-8110-7f7b15780554: Zen archers are proficient with longbows, shortbows, composite longbows, and composite shortbows in addition to their normal {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}weapon proficiencies{/g}.
